newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's ASC says secures A$100 mln in Austwide.
newsitem.headline: Australia's ASC says secures A$100 mln in Austwide.

text.p: The Australian Securities Commission (ASC) said on Friday it had secured A$100 million for 23,000 unitholders in the collapsed Austwide property trust.
The case was brought against Permanent Trustee Australia Ltd and its guarantor Permanent Trustee Co Ltd.
"This is the largest settlement ever facilitated by the ASC," the securities regulator said in a statement.
The ASC said it would hold a news conference later on Friday to release details of the settlement.
In the court case, the ASC had claimed A$210 million against Permanent Trustee Australia Ltd for making alleged hazardous investments.
The ASC alleged two cases of breach of trust -- making an unauthorised investment and making a speculative and hazardous investment.
The ASC had alleged that said the breaches by Permanent led to the loss of A$145 million of unitholders' investments.

The case focused on investments made by Permanent as trustee of Austwide from April 1988 to December 1990 in units of the Northbourne Securities Property Trust, which built the 1 O'Connell Street office complex in Sydney.
The building was sold in 1994 for less than the development debt, leaving nothing for the Austwide investors, the ASC had said.
